# Setting Git up
Before you start using Git, you need to 

## Identify yourself {{< fa clock >}}

Before you get going with Git, it is necessary for you to set an username and email.
You can later change this. You can do this using the Terminal. 

```{bash}

git config --global user.name "Example"
git config --global user.email beispiel@example.com

```


## Set Git editor

```{bash}

git config --global core.editor "emacs"

```

## Configure the default name for an initial branch

```{bash}

git config --global init.defaultBranch main

```

## Check your Settings

You can check if you configurations worked using

```{bash}

git config --list

```

You should recive an output.

```{bash}

user.name=Example
user.email=beispiel@example.com
init.defaultbranch=main
core.editor=Atom

```
